articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Laila Bassam, Timour Azhari
articles.description: The United States is leading a diplomatic dash to deter Israel from striking Lebanon's capital Beirut or major civil infrastructure in response to a deadly rocket attack on the Golan Heights, five people with knowledge of the drive said.
articles.title: Don't bomb Beirut: U.S. leads push to rein in Israel's response

articles.author: Julia Cobb
articles.description: President Nicolas Maduro and his opposition rival Edmundo Gonzalez both claimed victory in Venezuela's presidential election on Monday as Washington and other foreign governments cast doubt on official results that gave the incumbent a win.
articles.title: Government, opposition both claim Venezuela election win, official results questioned

articles.author: James Oliphant, Tim Reid
articles.description: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump's campaign will launch a $10 million advertising blitz in six battleground states this week as it tries to counter a surge of voter enthusiasm and donations for his Democratic rival Kamala Harris.
articles.title: Trump launches ad blitz to try to slow Harris surge

articles.author: Matt Spetalnick, Phil Stewart
articles.description: The Biden administration said on Monday that electoral manipulation had stripped the announcement of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro's reelection victory of "any credibility," and Washington left the door open to fresh sanctions on the OPEC nation.
articles.title: US accuses Venezuela of election manipulation, leaves door open to sanctions

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Ramadan Abed
articles.description: Thousands of Palestinians fled a community in the central Gaza Strip on Monday in the face of new Israeli evacuation orders, worsening the humanitarian plight in an area already inundated with displaced people fleeing an assault in the south.
articles.title: As fighting rages, displaced Gazans struggle with disease and lack of shelter

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Israeli drone strike killed two people and wounded three more in southern Lebanon on Monday, the Lebanese civil defence said, as Lebanon braced for Israeli retaliation following a rocket strike that killed 12 teenagers and children at the weekend.
articles.title: Lebanon braces for Israeli retaliation, strike kills 2 in south Lebanon

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Up to 100 people were feared injured on Monday when a passenger train derailed in Russia's southern Volgograd region, Russian news agencies reported.
articles.title: Up to 100 feared injured after passenger train derails in southern Russia

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The leadership of moderate separatist party Esquerra Republicana de Catalunya (ERC) has approved an initial agreement to support Spain's Socialists to form a regional government in the rich northeastern region, party spokesperson Raquel Sans said on Monday.
articles.title: Catalan separatist party leaders agree to form government with Socialists

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Morocco's King Mohammed VI ordered on Monday the release of jailed journalists Taoufik Bouachrine, Omar Radi and Soulaimane Raisouni, as part of a pardon benefiting 2,476 convicts, a government source said.
articles.title: Morocco releases jailed journalists, pardons 2,476 convicts

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Former South African president Jacob Zuma has been expelled from his long-time party, the African National Congress, the ANC's secretary general said on Monday.
articles.title: South Africa's ANC expels former president Zuma
